SharpMermaid
Table of Contents

Visualize Project Dependencies

Description

Description As a developer,
I want to generate a diagram that shows the dependencies between projects in a solution,
so that I can gain a high-level understanding of the application's structure.

Rules

  1. The diagram must include nodes representing each project in the solution.
  2. The diagram must show directed connections (arrows) representing dependencies defined by ProjectReference entries.
  3. Each project node may include additional metadata (descriptions).
  4. Nodes must be interactive, supporting tooltips and click actions.

Scenarios

Generate Dependency Diagram

Given the solution contains multiple projects with dependencies
When the dependency diagram is generated
Then the diagram should include:

  • Nodes for each project in the solution
  • Directed connections representing ProjectReference dependencies.

Tooltips to Project Nodes

Given a project contains metadata in its <Description> tag When the dependency diagram is generated Then the project node should display a tooltip containing the description when hovered over.

Clickable Project Nodes

Given a project is displayed in the dependency diagram

When a project node is clicked

Then the user should be redirected to the class diagram of that project.
